column1: '''Fenmarch''' was a region of eastern [[Rohan]] that stretched from the [[Firienholt
column2: Firien Wood]] along the [[Mering Stream]], and therefore marked part of [[Rohan]]'s eastern border with [[Gondor]].<ref>{{RK

column1: The fen element of the name means "marsh" and is a reference to the wetlands along the [[Mering Stream]]. ''March'' is an old word for "borderland" - a reference to the border with [[An√≥rien]] - and has the same derivation as [[Riddermark
column2: Mark]], a name for the whole country of Rohan.<ref name="Nomen"/>
Tolkien]] writes that on reflection he would have preferred the form "Fenmark", to the extent that he recommended this alternative version for translated versions of the book.<ref name="Nomen">{{HM
